availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Julius Rowley Pomeroy (Brooklyn, New York, teacher, commissioner of deeds, and attorney)

body.p: Brooklyn, New York, teacher, commissioner of deeds, and attorney. Native of Ireland. Married to Elvena F. Sherman Pomeroy. Father of Edward Pomeroy. Attended Wesleyan University in Middletown, Connecticut, in 1847. Teacher in Brooklyn, New York in 1850. Commissioner of Deeds for Kentucky in Brooklyn in 1861. Attorney in Brooklyn in 1865. Employed Celia Cumming as a servant in Brooklyn in 1865. Commissioner of Deeds for Kentucky in Brooklyn in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Brooklyn, Kings County, New York City, Ward 3, p. 220B.
New York, U.S., State Census (1865), Population Schedules, Brooklyn, Kings County, New York City, p. 20.
Catalogue of the Officers and Students of Wesleyan University, 1846-47, (Middletown, CT: W. D. Starr, Printer, 1847), 12.
The Brooklyn City Directory for the Year Ending May 1st, 1865 (Brooklyn, NY: J. Lain and Company, 1865), 333.
Find A Grave, "Julius Rowley Pomeroy (Unknown-1877)," Memorial #182852201, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/182852201 (accessed June 15, 2021).
